intro: Serjania communis var. pilosula, commonly known as the hairy serjania, is a species of flowering plant in the family Clethraceae. It is native to parts of South America, particularly Brazil, and is characterized by its distinctive, hairy foliage. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine, soft hairs, giving it a unique texture. The flowers are small, clustered, and usually white or pale yellow, contributing to its ornamental value in horticulture.
